newsitem.title: CHINA: New Hong Kong leader to visit PLA naval base.
newsitem.headline: New Hong Kong leader to visit PLA naval base.

text.p: Hong Kong's leader Tung Chee-hwa will visit the new Chinese garrison on Wednesday, his first since China took back the region from Britain a week ago, the government said on Monday.
Tung would visit the People's Liberation Army (PLA) navy base on Stonecutters Island in the middle of Hong Kong harbour, where Britain previously had its naval headquarters.
The gesture would return a visit paid to Tung last Friday by the PLA garrison chief, Major-General Liu Zhenwu, the government said in a statement.
Tung would take along Chief Secretary Anson Chan, Financial Secretary Donald Tsang and Security Secretary Peter Lai.
Appointed by China to run Hong Kong from July 1 after Britain handed over its former colony, Tung will welcome the PLA troops responsible for Hong Kong's defence. They number almost 5,000 personnel.
